note.p: Teacher. Son of John Smith, baker, and Elizabeth, of 37 Old Market Street, Bristol. Studied at Cambridge (Corpus Christi College), 1879–80. BA, London University, 1889. Mathematics tutor in Hove, Sussex, 1891. Army tutor and partner in a school in Dover, Kent, 1901. Bursar and assistant master at Dover College, army tutor, and x-ray operator at Dover Hospital, 1911.
Census returns of England and Wales 1871 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG10/2524/8/10), 1881 (RG11/2085/98/31), 1891 (RG12/816/17/27), 1901 (RG13/839/7/4), 1911 (RG14/4595/322)
England & Wales, national probate calendar (index of wills and administrations), 1858–1966 (Ancestry.com, accessed 15 September 2016)

ref.hi: Historical record of the University of London
